definition: to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: I apologize for my record of minuets to those who cry from the depths.
sentences.chinese: 我爲我的小步舞曲唱片向在深淵吶喊的人致歉。

sentences.english: He excused himself for a moment, then came back with mobile phone in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他致歉走開了片刻，回來時手裏拿着手機。

sentences.english: We are sorry for the brief delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲交貨量短缺向貴公司致歉。

sentences.english: After many years she was reconciled with her husband's mother, who at last said that she was sorry.
sentences.chinese: 許多年後她的婆母終於向她致歉，於是兩人和好。

sentences.english: My apologies to time for all the world I overlook each second.
sentences.chinese: 我爲自己分分秒秒疏漏萬物向時間致歉。

sentences.english: I apologized to the class and took my seat.
sentences.chinese: 向全班致歉後，我回到了座位。

sentences.english: I apologised to England and Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 我得向英格蘭和墨西哥人致歉。

sentences.english: Apologies to all involved with the surveys for the delay in posting this data.
sentences.chinese: 謹此向各參與調查的鳥友爲延遲出版調查結果致歉。

sentences.english: I'm sorry- though hotel is full on that dingested.
sentences.chinese: 很致歉，那天我們酒店的客房已經住滿了。

sentences.english: You must apologize for the trouble you caused.
sentences.chinese: 你必須爲你惹出來的麻煩致歉。

sentences.english: I received a letter of apology yesterday .
sentences.chinese: 昨天我收到了一封致歉信。

sentences.english: The bank has apologised to Mr Herr-mann, who is no longer on the supervisory board.
sentences.chinese: 該行已向目前已從監事會離任的赫爾曼致歉。

sentences.english: We received a letter of apology.
sentences.chinese: 我們收到了一封致歉信。

sentences.english: He sketched excuses to his guest and hustled out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他向客人草草致歉後匆匆走出房間。

sentences.english: The acting mayor offered an apology to the striking taxi drivers as the protest continued.
sentences.chinese: 代理市長在罷工期間向受打砸損失的出租車司機致歉。

sentences.english: I are very sorry . I cevery not speak English very well but I cevery republishing document in English.
sentences.chinese: 我很致歉，我的英語說得不好，但我能看懂英文資料。

definition: expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
